extended_event_descriptor.text: In the midst of enduring winter, finding food becomes a priority as resources dwindle, leaving some desperate for their next meal.

Flying is one of the safest forms of transport. But what happens when tragedy strikes? Follow experts as they determine what went wrong and work out how to prevent these horrific tragedies from happening again...
MIA CBP investigates a traveler suspected of smuggling drugs internally. JFK HSI conduct a controlled delivery of ecstasy in Manhattan on Wall street.

Discover how creamy cheesesake, melt-in-your-mouth perogies, top-notch ice cream sandwiches, and the freshest marmalade get to the masses. From raw materials to finished products, Food Factory reveals the wonders of how food is really made.
Tim and Fuzz take on 63 year old Kel's 1962 Triumph TR4. His planned restoration sadly ground to a halt when a brutal stroke robbed him of most of his vision.
The Science of Stupid is the show that combines cold hard science with some of the craziest, most spectacular and painful user generated clips ever recorded.

There are cars - and then there are supercars. Supercars takes a rare look behind-the-scenes at some of the planet's most exclusive factories, where artistry and engineering combine to make the meanest megacars on the road

Discover how creamy cheesesake, melt-in-your-mouth perogies, top-notch ice cream sandwiches, and the freshest marmalade get to the masses. From raw materials to finished products, Food Factory reveals the wonders of how food is really made.
Atomic explosions on ships at sea. The USA's largest thermonuclear bomb. A new survey using extraordinary CGI explores the dawn of the Nuclear Age.
Series following the investigations of underwater archaeologists as they investigate and examine various sunken ships and submarines
Our quest to conquer the skies led to some great achievements. But engineering errors and human mistakes have caused tragic disasters along the way.
Tells the stories of people who, through naivety, stupidity or plain bad luck have been caught smuggling drugs or another illegal item they've been tricked into carrying through customs.
Our quest to conquer the skies led to some great achievements. But engineering errors and human mistakes have caused tragic disasters along the way.
Tim and Fuzz take on 63 year old Kel's 1962 Triumph TR4. His planned restoration sadly ground to a halt when a brutal stroke robbed him of most of his vision.
The Science of Stupid is the show that combines cold hard science with some of the craziest, most spectacular and painful user generated clips ever recorded.
Tim and Fuzz take on 63 year old Kel's 1962 Triumph TR4. His planned restoration sadly ground to a halt when a brutal stroke robbed him of most of his vision.
The Science of Stupid is the show that combines cold hard science with some of the craziest, most spectacular and painful user generated clips ever recorded.

We revisit the greatest moments from America's decade of decadence when everything went big.from shoulder pads to bank balances. Huge passion led to huge profit, and amidst an explosion of luxury brands and unbridled credit, we splashed the cash like
Street Genius is apopscience/engineering "game show" that challenges the global public to pick the right outcome to incredible experiments.
Rise of the Machines uses CGI animations to 'explode apart' some of the world's most extreme machines to reveal the extraordinary engineering at the heart of their design.
New technology reveals how Tutankhamun's resting place remained hidden for so long and an amazing new discovery in a 4000 year old tomb.
Quanzhou marked the end-point of the Maritime Silk Road. Goods, cultures and faiths melded here, and its fame spread as far as mediaeval Europe.
The Science of Stupid is the show that combines cold hard science with some of the craziest, most spectacular and painful user generated clips ever recorded.
Rains that are almost biblical, heat waves that don't end, tornadoes that strike in savage swarms-there's been a change in the weather lately. What's going on?
In the midst of enduring winter, finding food becomes a priority as resources dwindle, leaving some desperate for their next meal.

Flying is one of the safest forms of transport. But what happens when tragedy strikes? Follow experts as they determine what went wrong and work out how to prevent these horrific tragedies from happening again...
MIA CBP investigates a traveler suspected of smuggling drugs internally. JFK HSI conduct a controlled delivery of ecstasy in Manhattan on Wall street.

There are cars - and then there are supercars. Supercars takes a rare look behind-the-scenes at some of the planet's most exclusive factories, where artistry and engineering combine to make the meanest megacars on the road

Discover how creamy cheesesake, melt-in-your-mouth perogies, top-notch ice cream sandwiches, and the freshest marmalade get to the masses. From raw materials to finished products, Food Factory reveals the wonders of how food is really made.

Retracing the construction phases of the incredible Airbus whaling cargo plane, BelugaXL. It was designed to speed up the transport of aircraft parts built across Europe to Toulouse, where assembly plants are located.

Eerily familiar ruins amidst shifting desert sands, legendary film sets with surprising pasts, and real locations that inspired Hollywood. Within these decaying structures are the echoes of history; each haunted shell with its own unique story.

Exceptional Engineering takes a look behind the scenes of the construction process of the world's most innovative vehicles. From the world's biggest cranes to the most modern airplane. From the largest motorbike factory and production site of the wor
Tells the stories of people who, through naivety, stupidity or plain bad luck have been caught smuggling drugs or another illegal item they've been tricked into carrying through customs.

Retracing the construction phases of the incredible Airbus whaling cargo plane, BelugaXL. It was designed to speed up the transport of aircraft parts built across Europe to Toulouse, where assembly plants are located.
The comedy duo have their work-cut out as they embark on more undercover missions rescuing classic cars and returning them in a surprise reveal to their much deserving owners.
The Science of Stupid is the show that combines cold hard science with some of the craziest, most spectacular and painful user generated clips ever recorded.
Tim and Fuzz take on 63 year old Kel's 1962 Triumph TR4. His planned restoration sadly ground to a halt when a brutal stroke robbed him of most of his vision.
New Balance reveal how high-tech machinery, hand crafting skills and global logistics combine to bring their best-selling sneaker to feet, the world over.

We revisit the greatest moments from America's decade of decadence when everything went big.from shoulder pads to bank balances. Huge passion led to huge profit, and amidst an explosion of luxury brands and unbridled credit, we splashed the cash like

The Akashi Kaikyo Bridge is a third longer than any other suspension bridge ever built. It's also the tallest and the most expensive, and built in a very treacherous place. It's been trouble-free for six years, but will it last?
This three-part series of special reports sets out to investigate some of the most devastating accidents in aviation history and examine what consequences they had for the industry.

When agents at Jorge Chavez International Airport detain a man with drugs in his suitcase, he breaks down when speaking with his mother. Meanwhile, a woman may be carrying cocaine-contaminated olives.
Tells the stories of people who, through naivety, stupidity or plain bad luck have been caught smuggling drugs or another illegal item they've been tricked into carrying through customs.

The Akashi Kaikyo Bridge is a third longer than any other suspension bridge ever built. It's also the tallest and the most expensive, and built in a very treacherous place. It's been trouble-free for six years, but will it last?
The C5 Galaxy was the biggest cargo plane ever. With the ability to carry more cargo further than any other plane and to land anywhere, the C-5 has been a crucial part of the US Military's arsenal.
As America closes in on Japan in 1944, the Japanese turn to desperate new tactics: killer planes and super torpedoes guided by human pilots.
By scanning the locations at the bottom of the ocean where sunken ships, treasures and even cities lie, the show tries to answer what they look like, how they got there and if they hide any secrets.

Sir Ranulph Fiennes, is returning to the scene of one of his earliest feats - his 1968 hovercraft expedition on the River Nile. As the 50th anniversary of that quest approaches he's ready for new adventures, fresh surprises and a novel challenge

short_event_descriptor.name: Riddle of The Stone Age Giants

extended_event_descriptor.text: Now, newly-discovered skull carvings reveal even more about how and why civilized societies developed
New technology reveals how Tutankhamun's resting place remained hidden for so long and an amazing new discovery in a 4000 year old tomb.
Professor Bettany Hughes travels from the Nile Delta to the shores of Lake Nasser to the many secrets of ancient Egypt, including the story of Egypt's final female pharaoh - Cleopatra.
Sam investigates the curse of Vlad Tepes, a 15th century eastern European ruler whose curse upon his Romanian homeland has lasted for six centuries.

In embattled rebel-held eastern Ukraine, Michael embeds himself with The Night Wolves: a Kremlin-backed biker gang who have a direct line to Putin and a penchant for pyrotechnics. Michael learns about The Night Wolves' mission on the frontline and se
Tim and Fuzz race to restore a 1959 Land Rover in just 7 days in the final studio special, celebrating 7 years of Car SOS. Will the car be ready for 80-year-old Brian?
The Science of Stupid is the show that combines cold hard science with some of the craziest, most spectacular and painful user generated clips ever recorded.
Tim and Fuzz take on 63 year old Kel's 1962 Triumph TR4. His planned restoration sadly ground to a halt when a brutal stroke robbed him of most of his vision.

We revisit the greatest moments from America's decade of decadence when everything went big.from shoulder pads to bank balances. Huge passion led to huge profit, and amidst an explosion of luxury brands and unbridled credit, we splashed the cash like

The Akashi Kaikyo Bridge is a third longer than any other suspension bridge ever built. It's also the tallest and the most expensive, and built in a very treacherous place. It's been trouble-free for six years, but will it last?
In an effort to break free of societal norms, the next generation of Alaskans must learn to survive by their own rules in harsh climates.
The teams of fishermen battle each other to see who can catch the most fish, while trying to earn their livelihood.
Fairbanks Gold owner John Reeves attempts to persuade his reluctant offspring to help him protect the family land.
The team go to demolish a paper mill but it has a tower that must come down without hitting any surrounding buildings-or members of the crew
Primal Survivor tracks wilderness guide and survival instructor Hazen Audel as he tackles some of mankind's most rigorous journeys, relying on skills learned from native inhabitants

Eerily familiar ruins amidst shifting desert sands, legendary film sets with surprising pasts, and real locations that inspired Hollywood. Within these decaying structures are the echoes of history; each haunted shell with its own unique story.

For decades, Korea and its people laboured under Japanese imperialist rule. But in 1912, in a small town outside Pyongyang, a child is born - Kim Il Sung, coinciding with an omen of imperialism's doom.

A shocking trail of blood and money: a sting operation and an attempt to save these magnificent animals from extinction. National Geographic uncovers the onslaught of an illicit trade that is enslaving tens of thousands of people and threatening to w
Virus Hunters reveals the chilling stories of heroic experts who are on the frontline leading the most critical scientific mission of a generation.
In Florida, a man mysteriously falls ill and dies. Special Agent Matthew Ryker suspects an anthrax attack - how many others have been infected?

WW2 Hell Under the Sea is an event-based series charting the stealth game of subsea warfare, tracking the dramatic narrative from contact to attack of the greatest submarine patrols of World War II.

short_event_descriptor.name: Attack on Pearl Harbor: Minute by Minute

extended_event_descriptor.text: This episode reveals the background to the surprise attack on Pearl Harbour.
